articles.description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez said rankings by Johns Hopkins University showed Spain was fifth in the world in testing rates. But those international rankings appear not to exist.

articles.description: It's been more than two months since Ahmaud Arbery was shot and killed in a south Georgia neighborhood, but in recent days the case has taken on new urgency as outrage over the killing has grown.

articles.title: 'Mrs. America' makes the case for messy history
articles.description: The thrill of Dahvi Waller's "Mrs. America," the new nine-part miniseries on Hulu chronicling the battle that flared in the 1970s over the passage of the Equal Rights Amendment, is that it resists the lure of easy history.

articles.title: Trump administration asks court to dismiss lawsuit to add ERA to US Constitution
articles.description: The Trump administration is asking a federal court to throw out a lawsuit from three attorneys general that seeks to add the Equal Rights Amendment to the US Constitution.

articles.title: Coronavirus leaves the Gulf's migrant workers in limbo, with no income and no easy way out
articles.description: Six Indian workers lie in bunk beds in the middle of a workday. Beyond the four walls of their small room in the United Arab Emirates, their options for maintaining a livelihood are becoming increasingly slim.

articles.title: Biden's campaign rushes to blunt Trump's digital advantage
articles.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's aides are reprogramming their analog campaign for a digital battle.

articles.author: Paul Gittings, CNN
articles.title: Diego Maradona autographs shirt to help poor district of Buenos Aires
articles.description: Diego Maradona is helping in the fight against coronavirus in his home city by autographing a replica of the Argentina jersey he wore in the country's 1986 World Cup final triumph to raise money for an underprivileged community.

articles.title: In pictures: Little Richard, founding father of rock 'n' roll
articles.description: Rock 'n' roll legend Little Richard has died, the entertainer's former agent confirmed. He was 87. The cause of death is related to bone cancer, Dick Alen told CNN.
articles.content:
Little Richard poses for a photo, circa 1965.
Rock 'n' roll legend Little Richard has died, the entertainer's former agent confirmed. He was 87.
The cause of death is related to bone cancer, Dick Alen told CNN.

articles.author: Chloe Melas And Todd Leopold
articles.title: Little Richard dies: Flamboyant rock legend was 87
articles.description: Little Richard, the screaming, preening, scene-stealing wild man of early rock 'n' roll with hits like "Tutti Frutti" and "Long Tall Sally," has died, Dick Alen, his former agent, has confirmed to CNN.
articles.content:
(CNN)Little Richard, the screaming, preening, scene-stealing wild man of early rock 'n' roll with hits like "Tutti Frutti" and "Long Tall Sally," has died at 87, Dick Alen, his former agent, confirmed to CNN.
This story is developing. Return for updates.

articles.author: Barbara Starr, CNN Pentagon Correspondent
articles.title: US Army pushing to develop wearable sensors to detect coronavirus symptoms
articles.description: The US Army is asking technology companies to develop wearable sensors to detect early symptoms of coronavirus. This week they invited initial proposals for a $25 million contract to develop a device that uses existing technology as much as possible.

articles.title: San Francisco sued over 'nightmare' neighborhood conditions
articles.description: In SF's Tenderloin district, after the number of tents jumped nearly 300%, residents, businesses and a nearby law school are suing to force the city to clean it up.

articles.title: Makeup sales take a hit as interests shift in the work-from-home era
articles.description: Makeup hasn't been on consumers' shopping lists during the pandemic, and sales have taken a hit.

articles.title: Obama slams Trump coronavirus response in private call
articles.description: Former President Barack Obama slammed President Donald Trump's coronavirus pandemic response during a web call with people who worked in his administration that was obtained by Yahoo News and verified by CNN. CNN's Kristen Holmes reports.

articles.author: Paul Gittings, CNN
articles.title: Top football leagues given option to scrap VAR when competition resumes
articles.description: The English Premier League (EPL) and other major football leagues have been given the option to scrap the use of VAR (Video Assistant Referee) when their competitions resume after being halted by the coronavirus pandemic.
